name: Liath

attributes.attribute: all the trees were cut down
called Druin Léith in his honor
double name of one of the great Fairy Mounds of Ireland

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: In Irish mythology, there exist multiple individuals bearing the name Liath who have attained heroic status. One of these individuals hailed from the Nemedian race, who was responsible for clearing all the trees from the hill of Tara in order to cultivate corn. As a result of his contributions, the hill was named Druin Léith to honor him. Another individual with the same name had feelings for a woman named Brí, however, their desire to wed was thwarted by their untimely deaths. Despite this, their legacy lives on through the joint name of Brí Léith, which was given to one of the prominent Fairy Mounds situated in Ireland.
